content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 210.4 - Residential moving expenses

State Regulations
(a) All eligible residential occupants will be entitled to reimbursement of actual, reasonable and necessary moving expenses or may elect a fixed amount in
accordance with the counted room schedule. If the eligible person elects to
receive payment in lieu of actual, reasonable and necessary moving expenses, the following provisions will apply: Schedule of

Payments
(Add $100 dislocation allowance)
lst room....... $50.00

Every room thereafter....... 25.00

Every 1/4 room after the 1st full room....... 12.50
(b) Tenants in furnished rooms, furnished
apartments and furnished mobile homes where the tenant provides nominal amount
of household furniture and personal property will be entitled to reimbursement
of actual, reasonable and necessary moving expenses or may elect a fixed
allowance equivalent to one counted room per the aforementioned schedule. When
garages, sheds, and outbuildings are acquired and the eligible person's place
of residence is not disturbed, or when the eligible person's principal place of
residence is not the appropriate site, a fixed allowance may be applied per the
aforementioned room count schedule less the $100 dislocation
allowance. (c) If the eligible
residential occupant elects to receive reimbursement for actual, reasonable and
necessary moving, he shall submit to the department, at least four weeks prior
to the moving date, one estimate or bid from a recognized household furniture
moving concern. Such estimate or bid is to be in a form prescribed by the
commissioner and as explained in section
210.3
of this Part. After receipt
of the estimate in acceptable form, an amount will be deemed reasonable and
necessary and the eligible person notified in writing to commence moving. Upon
completion of the actual move, reasonable and necessary moving expenses will be
paid based upon receipted bills submitted to the department in an acceptable
form. Reimbursement of moving expenses will be limited to the amount of the
approved estimate and will be exclusive of any additional charges submitted by
the eligible person, his family or others not normally in the moving business, for packing, moving or incidental work. In the case of failure to notify the
commissioner as provided above, it will be assumed that the eligible person
waives the right to elect to receive reimbursement for actual, reasonable and
necessary moving expenses and such person will be paid a lump sum amount based
on the counted room schedule and consistent with the above
provisions. Notes
